intro: Platymiscium blanchetii, commonly known as the white-flowered ash tree, is a deciduous tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by small, round fruits. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
